required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Subanesthetic Sevoflurane for Treatment-Resistant Depression: A Proof-of-Concept Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai First Maternity and Infant Hospital

collaborator.agency: Shanghai Pudong New Area Mental Health Center

clinical_study.source: Shanghai First Maternity and Infant Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: This study intends to carry out a prospective, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of subanesthetic sevoflurane for treatment-resistant depression.

primary_outcome.measure: Rates of treatment responses in 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS-17)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after the end of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of treatment responses in HDRS-17
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 7 days,14 days and 28 days after the end of treatment
2 hours, 24 hours, 7 days,14 days and 28 days after the end of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of treatment responses in Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 24 hours, 7 days,14 days and 28 days after the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: ≥50% MADRS reduction in the baseline score

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 24 hours, 7 days,14 days and 28 days after the end of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: The assessment of depression with self-rating scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 24 hours, 7 days,14 days and 28 days after the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of score in Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9)

secondary_outcome.measure: The assessment of anxiety by psychiatrist
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 24 hours, 7 days,14 days and 28 days after the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of score in Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale (HAMA)

secondary_outcome.measure: The assessment of anxiety with self-rating scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 24 hours, 7 days,14 days and 28 days after the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of score in Generalized Anxiety Disorder Screener (GAD-7)

secondary_outcome.measure: The assessment of improvement by psychiatrist
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 24 hours, 7 days,14 days and 28 days after the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of score in Clinical Global Impression (CGI)

secondary_outcome.measure: The assessment of improvement with self-rating scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 24 hours, 7 days,14 days and 28 days after the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The changes of score in Patient Global Impressions of Improvement (PGI-I)

secondary_outcome.measure: The assessment of side effects with self-rating scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours, 24 hours, 7 days,14 days and 28 days after the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Including Patient Rated Inventory of Side Effects (PRISE)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 2 hours after the end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Including nausea, vomiting, headache, dizzy, hypotension, hypoxemia, carbon dioxide accumulation, et al

arm_group.description: Those with 1-hour inhalation of 1% sevoflurane/30% oxygen

intervention.description: Patients receive 1% sevoflurane and 30% oxygen for 1 hour.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. age 18-65 years
2. meeting DSM-V criteria for major depressive disorder
3. a pretreatment score ≥17 on HDRS-17
4. meeting criteria for TRD, defined as having had at least two adequate dose-duration antidepressant medication failures in the current depressive episode.
5. current treatment drugs were stably used for at least 4 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
1. MDD with psychosis, e.g., bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder, panic disorder, et al
2. Drug, tobacco or alcohol abuse
3. active suicidal intention
4. previous administration of NMDA receptor antagonists (e.g., ketamine)
5. previous (<6 weeks prior) or ongoing treatment with electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) or transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS)
6. pregnancy or breastfeeding
7. morbidly obese, BMI>35kg/m2
8. other diseases that could interfere with the results

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Anesthesiaology, Shanghai First Maternity and Infant Hospital, Tongji University School of Medicine

facility.name: Shanghai First Maternity and Infant Hospital, Tongji University School of Medicine
